name: Le Clos de Mutigny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's worth the detour - although not far away from the motorway. A very pleasant summer stop. We had no trouble with the room, although we weren't on the side near the noisy river. Nice gardens. Excellent dinner on the terrace, and good breakfast.
reviews.title: Worth the detour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Very pleasant small hotel with excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly staff. You get the feel of a small, family run hotel.
reviews.title: OK, but that's all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Very welcoming, charming location - great food!

reviews.text: Room was on the small side but this did not count against it. It was cosy. We also had twin beds but this was the only room left since we booked very late. Room was clean and nice. Not modern but tastefully decorated.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We found this to be a very friendly and welcoming hotel, just a short drive south of Reims and therefore convenient for the channel ports if on a motoring holiday. Access is easy, just off the main road (N44), but the village is by-passed, so there's no noise. The hotel is in a large garden with a mill stream flowing through it. Plenty of parking, but be wary of parking under the trees as the birds that roost in them like taking target practice on cars! The owners speak good English and are very welcoming and attentive. The rooms are quite small, but perfectly adequate and the beds are comfortable. Everuthing was spotlessly clean. The resyaurant is also first class with a good selection to choose from. BReakfast is a buffet with a wide selection.
reviews.title: Great overnight stop and restaurant

reviews.text: We had a stop over here on the way back to Calais, I wish we could have stayed longer! It is about 15mins off motorway, wonderful location right by the river. Lovely welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff, great evening meal.
reviews.title: A true gem, beautiful location, friendly staff, great value

reviews.text: The grounds are lovely with a great play area for small children.
reviews.title: New owners-looks promising

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very practical, comfortable and with a small bedroom off it for the childrens bunk beds aswell as the ensuite.
reviews.title: Stay away from their 'pavilion'

likes.disliked: — Damp and smelly room, disfunctioning shower drainage and very loud music on the terrace

reviews.text: We will definitley return to this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Friendly quiet hotel in rural France
Give it a miss
reviews.text: We arrived having driven all day from Pisa. Despite an email confirmation of our booking the manager said he had sold our room to someone else and only had room 13 in the annexe available! It was cold and damp (in July!) and in a room for two, there was one towel. We left at 8am the following day feeling glad to put it behind us. What was most frustrating was that the manager really couldn't be bothered - all enquiries met with one word answers. Have stayed in much better and much cheaper hotels in France.

I shall give them the benefit of the doubt. It was Sunday, and not many hotels in the area will accept you on a Sunday. Nevertheless, since they belong to the Qualité Tourisme and Logis de France organisations, you expect that they would at least aspire to provide some semblance of a welcome. In the event, neither this, nor any solicited information about places to see, was forthcoming.
reviews.title: Avoid on Sundays

reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable but quite small. The en suite bathroom was fine. Breakfast was below average.
reviews.title: Appalling service
Avoid!!!
reviews.text: The hotel itself, which is quite large, looked very interesting: the gardens were the only commendable aspect of this visit. The village has nothing, and the closest big town, Chalons-en-Champagne is not too interesting either.

reviews.title: Great Exerience
reviews.text: We arrived a party of 6 including my father aged 66 and youngest child aged 4 on Sunday 26th August having travelled from Mulheim in Germany all day by car. We were all extemely tired and looking forward to some country hospitality. How wrong we were. The host is quite the rudest man I have ever had the misfortune to meet. The kitchens were closed on Sunday and despite our exhaustion he was unprepared to even offer a sandwich or coffee by way of room service. He made no attempt to show us to our rooms or help with bags and was surly and curt on proffering our keys. The hotel itself may be charming to look at but is located in a quiet backwater offering a goat farm or pizzeria a drive away. Finding the hotel in the first place had us lost many times and it should be made clear that it is not in the town of Chalons en champagne as we had expected. A huge and bitter disappointment. How does it keep its two stars?

aka: Le Clos De Mutigny France/Champagne-Ardenne - Marne
description: An elegant residence where fresh air and tranquillity offer the perfect setting for relaxation. Perfectly located for surrounding vineyards. Our restaurant offers a nice view on the river and fine cuisine, interesting wine and Champagne list
